metadata.Title: CVE-2019-6227 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A memory corruption issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in iOS 12.1.3, tvOS 12.1.2, watchOS 5.1.3, Safari 12.0.3, iTunes 12.9.3 for Windows, iCloud for Windows 7.10. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-6227` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.22.5-1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.1 - 2.22.5-1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-6.0 - 2.22.5-1
gir1.2-webkit-6.0 - 2.22.5-1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.22.5-1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.1 - 2.22.5-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.22.5-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.22.5-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.1-0 - 2.22.5-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-6.0-1 - 2.22.5-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.22.5-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.1-0 - 2.22.5-1
libwebkitgtk-6.0-4 - 2.22.5-1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.22.5-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.22.5-1').
